meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>char</kanji>, but the verb version is <vocabulary>to be burned</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to get burned</vocabulary>. You're not doing the burning, of course, but you're getting burned (owch!).
readingMnemonic: The times where you were burned were mostly when you were a <reading>子</reading> (こ). That's because kids aren't good at working with hot things.
